|cpu1_cores = 2 |cpu1_type = MIPS 34Kc |cpu1_type_rev = |cpu1spd = |is_doc = |bus = |flash1type = |fla1_num = |fla1chip = STMicro;NAND256W3A2BZA6; |flash1size = 32 |flash1maxsize = |ram1type = |ram1type1 = |ram1spd = |ram1size = 64 |ram1chip = SK hynix;H5DU5162EFR-E3C; |ram1_num = |nvramsize = |eth_cpu = true |eth2chip = Lantiq;PEF 7071V; |eth3chip = Lantiq;PEF 7071V; |sw1chip = Lantiq;PSB 6972;XWAY TANTOS, PSB 6972 V, V1.3; |dsl_ports = |voip_ports = |wan_ports = 1 |wan_speed = 1GbE |lan_ports = 1 |lan_speed = 1GbE |lan2_ports = 3 |lan2_speed = 100MbE |totlan = 4 |ethstandard = |portbasedvlan = |802.1qvlan = |auto_mdix = |sup_jumbo = |ethoui = |oui = |bootwait = |stockbootloader = |stockos = |exp_if_types = USB 2.0 |exp_usb_num = 1 |usb_hub = |pwr_volt_type = VDC |pwr_vdc = 12 |pwr_amp_dc = 1 |pwr_conn = barrel |pwr_barrel_outer = |pwr_barrel_inner = |pwr_barrel_len = |pwr_pol = |serial = |jtag = |specialfeat = |flags = ADSL2+ |addchip = |802dot11_protocols = bgn |defaulip = |defaultlogin = |defaultpass = |defaultssid = BTHub3-XXXX |defaultssid_regex = ^BTHub3-[0-9A-F]{4}$ |default_ch = |manuf = Askey |manuf_model = RTA4525W |manuf_rev = -D31 |is_manuf = No |tpfirmware = |availability = |eoldate = |fccapprovdate = |estreldate = |estprice = |upc = |ean = |dx_sku = |newegg = |asin = |asin_country = |asin2 = |asin_country2 = |countrymanuf = |buttons = |led = |dimensions = |weight = |wi1_if_name = |rad1chip1 = Atheros;AR9227;AR9227-BC2A; |rad1oui = |rad1_ant_conn = |rad1txchains = 2 |rad1rxchains = 2 |rad1sstreams = 2 |rad1stand = IEEE 802.11b/g/n |rad1n = 300 |rad1g = 54 |rad1b = 11 |rad1freq = 2.4 }}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== This device appears to be mostly identical to the [[BT Business Hub 3.0]]. :This device may have 64MB RAM. The default SSID appears to be '''BTHub3-XXXX''' where '''XXXX''' :is some combination of hex digits (upper case letters). '''Note:''' There are two Gigabit Ethernet ports on this device (WAN + LAN4).
This includes the red WAN port and the right most port on the LAN switch. ==Links of Interest== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/BT_Home_Hub ''BT Home Hub'' on '''Wikipedia'''] *[http://www.techdigest.tv/2011/05/review_bt_home.html ''Home Hub 3A'' Review on '''TechDigest'''] *[http://gadgetcat.wordpress.com/2011/02/19/home-hub-3-disassembly/ ''Home Hub 3A Disassembly'' on '''GadgetCat'''] :"RTA4525W-D31(RoHS) Rev:4" is silkscreened on the board. ==Pictures==
